mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Pearce, 1796 December 18
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington writes about lack of rain-Mr. Alexander Smith-Mr. Lear-the ground, where ivy and wild honey suckle are to be planted, is not to be plowed beforehand-Frank, Hercules, and Cyrus-Allison--Washington is displeased with the gardener's conduct-GW would like the new road completed before spring-Mr. Neal continues indisposed and the carpenters do nothing-Sall, Mima and Dick are regularly returned sick-Mr. Anderson expects to arrive by the 27th-clover grass seeds. Autograph letter signed, docketed, 4 pages.
